intro: Polyosma finisterrae, commonly known as the Canary Islands hakea, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively in the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and compact growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pink, adding ornamental value to its natural setting. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Polyosma finisterrae is considered a vulnerable species.
